lines: Purpose: Measure academic stress, exam pressure & burnout
Target group: Senior school students, college students, aspirants
Time frame: Over the last 1 month
Below are statements about studies, exams, expectations, and academic life.
Please choose how much each statement applied to you during the past one month.
Response Options & Weights (Same for ALL Questions)
•  0 – This did not apply to me at all.
•  3 – This applied to me a lot.
•  0 – I did not feel fear or anxiety about exams.
•  1 – I felt slight fear about exams.
•  2 – I felt moderate fear about exams.
•  3 – I felt strong fear about exams.
•  4 – I felt extreme fear or panic about exams.
Q2. Pressure to score high marks
•  0 – I did not feel pressure to score high marks.
•  1 – I felt slight pressure to score high marks.
•  2 – I felt moderate pressure to score high marks.
•  3 – I felt strong pressure to score high marks.
•  4 – I felt extreme pressure to score high marks.
•  0 – I did not fear academic failure.
•  4 – I felt extreme fear of failure.
•  0 – I did not feel pressure from my family regarding studies.
•  1 – I felt slight pressure from my family.
•  2 – I felt moderate pressure from my family.
•  3 – I felt strong pressure from my family.
•  4 – I felt extreme pressure from my family.
•  0 – I did not compare myself with other students.
•  1 – I compared myself slightly with others.
•  2 – I compared myself moderately with others.
•  3 – I compared myself a lot with others.
•  4 – I constantly compared myself with others.
•  0 – I did not fear disappointing others academically.
•  4 – I felt extreme fear of disappointing others.
•  0 – I had enough time for studies and rest.
•  4 – I constantly felt there was no time at all.
Q9. Difficulty balancing life and studies
•  0 – I balanced studies and personal life well.
•  1 – I had slight difficulty balancing both.
•  2 – I had moderate difficulty balancing both.
•  3 – I had severe difficulty balancing both.
•  4 – I could not balance studies and life at all.
•  0 – I did not feel mentally exhausted due to studies.
•  4 – I felt completely burned out mentally.
•  0 – I did not lose motivation for studying.
•  4 – I completely lost motivation to study.
•  0 – I did not feel emotionally drained due to academics.
•  0 – I did not worry about my future career.
•  1 – I worried slightly about my career.
•  2 – I worried moderately about my career.
•  3 – I worried a lot about my career.
•  4 – I felt extreme anxiety about my future career.
Q14. Fear of not meeting career expectations
•  0 – I did not fear failing career expectations.
•  4 – I felt extreme fear of failing career expectations.
•  0 – I did not feel stuck in my academics.
•  4 – I felt completely stuck and directionless.
Total Academic Stress Score = Sum of Q1–Q15
•  High expectations score → family/social pressure counselling
•  High burnout score → rest, sleep & mental health screening
“Our Academic Stress Scale is a culturally adapted screener designed for Indian students, capturing
exam pressure, expectations, workload, burnout, and career anxiety to enable early support.”
